model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board class for the game Connect Four.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jan-Jaap van Raffe and Wouter Bos

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int HEIGHT
      The Height of the Board.
      static int WIDTH
      The Width of the Board.

      Creates an empty Board.

      • deepCopy

        public Board deepCopy()
        Creates a deep copy of this Board.
        Returns:
        Returns a copy of this Board.

      • index

        public int index(int row,
                 int col)
        Calculates the index in the linear array of fields from a (row, col) pair.
        Parameters:
        row - the row
        col - the column
        Returns:
        the index belonging to the (row,col)-field

      • isField

        public boolean isField(int i)
        Returns true if i is a valid index of a field on this Board.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the field.
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= i < HEIGHT * WIDTH

      • isField

        public boolean isField(int row,
                       int col)
        Returns true of the (row,col) pair refers to a valid field on this Board.
        Parameters:
        row - the row
        col - the column
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= row < HEIGHT && 0 <= col < WIDTH

      • getField

        public Mark getField(int i)
        Returns the content of the field i.
        Parameters:
        i - the number of the field (see NUMBERING)
        Returns:
        the mark on the field

                     int col)
        Returns the content of the field referred to by the (row,col) pair.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the field
        col - the column of the field
        Returns:
        the mark on the field

      • isEmptyField

        public boolean isEmptyField(int i)
        Returns true if the field i is empty.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the field (see NUMBERING)
        Returns:
        true if the field is empty

      • isEmptyField

        public boolean isEmptyField(int row,
                            int col)
        Returns true if the field referred to by the (row,col) pair it empty.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the field
        col - the column of the field
        Returns:
        true if the field is empty

      • isColumn

        public boolean isColumn(int col)
        Returns true if i is a valid column of this board.
        Parameters:
        col - the column
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= i < WIDTH

      • containsEmptyColumn

        public boolean containsEmptyColumn(int col)
        Returns true if the column contains an empty field.
        Parameters:
        col - the column
        Returns:
        true if the column contains an empty field

      • determineField

        public int determineField(int col)
        When a player makes a move, this method determines the field where the Mark will be placed.
        Parameters:
        col - the column
        Returns:
        lowest field on the board. (highest index, highest row)

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Tests if the whole Board is full.
        Returns:
        true if all fields are occupied

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Returns true if the game is over. The game is over when there is a winner or the whole Board is full.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over

      • hasRow

        public boolean hasRow(Mark m)
        Checks whether there is a row which connects four marks m.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark of interest
        Returns:
        true if there is a row which connects four marks m

      • hasColumn

        public boolean hasColumn(Mark m)
        Checks whether there is a column which connects four marks m .
        Parameters:
        m - the mark of interest
        Returns:
        true if there is a column which connects four marks m

      • hasDiagonal

        public boolean hasDiagonal(Mark m)
        Checks whether there is a diagonal which connects four marks m.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark of interest
        Returns:
        true if there is a diagonal which connects four marks m

      • checkDiagonalLeftRight

        public boolean checkDiagonalLeftRight(Mark m,
                                      int i)
        Checks whether the given Diagonal at field[i] from the top left to the bottom right of the Board connects four Marks m.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark of interest
        i - the beginning field of the Diagonal
        Returns:
        true if this diagonal connects four Marks m

      • checkDiagonalRightLeft

        public boolean checkDiagonalRightLeft(Mark m,
                                      int i)
        Checks whether the given Diagonal at field[i] from the top right to the bottom left of the Board connects four Marks m.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark of interest
        i - the beginning field of the Diagonal
        Returns:
        true if this diagonal connects four Marks m

      • isWinner

        public boolean isWinner(Mark m)
        Checks if the mark m has won. A mark wins if it connects four vertically, horizontally or diagonally
        Parameters:
        m - the mark of interest
        Returns:
        true if the mark has won

      • hasWinner

        public boolean hasWinner()
        Returns true if the game has a winner. This is the case when one of the marks connects four vertically, horizontally or diagonally.
        Returns:
        true if the Board has a winner.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this Board. In addition to the current situation, the String also shows the numbering of the columns.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the game situation as String

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Empties all fields of this Board (i.e., let them refer to the value Mark.XXX).

      • setField

        public void setField(int i,
                     Mark m)
        Sets the content of field i to the mark m.
        Parameters:
        i - the field number (see NUMBERING)
        m - the mark to be placed

      • setField

        public void setField(int row,
                     int col,
                     Mark m)
        Sets the content of the field represented by the (row,col) pair to the mark m.
        Parameters:
        row - the field's row
        col - the field's column
        m - the mark to be placed
